alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 9:52PM AKST until December 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 9 AM AKST SUNDAY FOR THE SOUTHERN COPPER BASIN FROM THE EDGERTON CUTOFF SOUTH AND EAST... * WHAT...Snow expected with lower elevation rain. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches along the Richardson Highway from Thompson Pass north to the Edgerton Highway. Rain expected along the Edgerton Highway and McCarthy Road. * WHERE...Southern Copper River Basin, from the Edgerton Cutoff south and east. * WHEN...From noon Saturday to 9 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow is expected through the day Saturday and will intensify overnight as a strong low moves south of Cordova and eventually inland over the Susitna Valley Sunday. Copper River winds will warm elevations below 1700 to above freezing overnight, allowing rain or mixed precipitation to fall at these elevations. The Richardson Highway will likely have variable precipitation type depending on elevation. Lower elevations like 46 mile will likely see rain at times through the event.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
